etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in The Lancet. From examiner + -ship

definitions: The office or function of examiner; especially a position on an examination board.
In the Republic of Ireland: the state or condition of being investigated or assisted by an examiner; an instance of this.

notes.text: Examinership was introduced by the Companies (Amendment) Act 1990. During the period of examination, the company has the protection of the court.
